Detailed Description

--------------------------------------------------------------------------- Copyright (c) 2016 u-blox AB, Sweden.

Any reproduction without written permission is prohibited by law.

Component : Bluetooth Serial File : cb_bt_serial.h

Description : Data management for RFCOMM based profiles such and Serial Port Profile (SPP).

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

Data management for RFCOMM based profiles such and Serial Port Profile (SPP).

Function Documentation

cb_int32 cbBSE_frameSize ( cbBCM_Handle  handle,
cb_uint32 *  pFrameSize 
)

Read max frame size for a data channel.

Parameters:
handle Connection handle
pFrameSize Max frame size for connection.
Returns:
If the operation is successful cbBSE_OK is returned.

cb_int32 cbBSE_getReadBuf ( cbBCM_Handle  handle,
cb_uint8 **  ppBuf,
cb_uint32 *  pLength 
)

Get received data.

Parameters:
handle Connection handle
ppBuf Pointer to data buffer
pLength Pointer to buffer length variable.
Returns:
cbBSE_OK is returned if data is available. If no data is available then cbBSE_NO_DATA is returned.

void cbBSE_handleMsg ( cb_uint32  msgId,
void *  pData 
)

Bluetooth serial message handling.

Shall not be called by application.

Parameters:
msgId Message id
pData Pointer to message data
Returns:
None

void cbBSE_init ( void   ) 

Initialization of Bluetooth serial manager.

Called during stack initialization. Shall not be called by application.

Returns:
None

cb_int32 cbBSE_open ( cbBCM_Handle  handle,
cbBSE_Callback *  pCallback 
)

Open a data channel.

Parameters:
handle Connection handle
pCallback Callback for data events.
Returns:
If the operation is successful cbBSE_OK is returned.

cb_int32 cbBSE_readBufConsumed ( cbBCM_Handle  handle,
cb_uint32  nBytes 
)

Notify that received data has been handled and underlying buffers can be freed.

Parameters:
handle Connection handle
nBytes Number of bytes consumed.
Returns:
If the operation is successful cbBSE_OK is returned.

cb_int32 cbBSE_write ( cbBCM_Handle  handle,
cb_uint8 *  pBuf,
cb_uint32  nBytes,
cb_int32  tag 
)

Send data to remote device.

A data confirmation event is generated when the data has been sent and a cbBSE_write call can be done.

Detailed description optionally verbose.

Parameters:
handle Connection handle
pBuf Data pointer
nBytes nBytes Size of data to be sent.
tag Tag passed as argument in corresponding data confirmation callback.
Returns:
If the operation is successful cbBSE_OK is returned.
